topic.title: AER Error Cases

table.title: Transparent Error: General PCI Express Error

entry.p: Uncorrectable Internal Error
Refer to Internal Error Handling
Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Header Log Overflow
An error that requires header logging is detected and either the number of recorded headers has reached 5, or the Multiple Header Recording Enable bit is not Set and the First Error Pointer is valid.
Log the correctable error in AER register of the specific function.
The error is masked by default.
Receiver Error
Log the correctable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Bad TLP
Detected by the PCIe switch port. The LCRC error or Seq.Num error.
No
Log the correctable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Bad DLLP
Detected by the PCIe switch port. The DLLP error.
No
Log the correctable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Reply Timer Timeout
Detected by the PCIe switch port.
No
Log the correctable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
REPLY_NUM Rollover
Detected by the PCIe switch port.
No
Log the correctable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Data Link Protocol Error
Detected by the PCIe switch port.
No
Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Surprise Down
Refer to the section PCIe Hotplug for detail
No
Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component

ul.li:
Transaction Layer Error
Transaction errors detected and handled by P2P bridge function
Transaction errors for TLP targeted to vEP control BAR
Transaction errors for TLP targeted to NT Window in NT EP, but TLP is terminated in source partition and not passed to destination partition.

entry.p: Poisoned TLP Received

row.entry: EP bit is set in received Write Request(Posted or Non-posted), Message with Data, Read Completion, though the TLP will still be forwarded as normal.

entry.p: Dependent upon whether the associated TLP targets a single function or all functions in the device.

row.entry: See table Poisoned TLP PCIe Error Report.

Non-advisory case: Uncorrectable error processing.
Advisory case: Correctable error processingSee table Poisoned TLP PCIe Error Report.

entry.p: Poisoned TLP Egress Blocked

If:
EP bit is set in Write Request(Posted or Non-posted), Message with Data, Read Completion.
The egress port's DPC poisoned blocked is set. Then it is a poisoned blocked error.

row.entry: Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component.

entry.p: ECRC Check Failed
If

ul.li: TD bit is set in a TLP.
ECRC Check is enabled in receiver function.

entry.p: Then the ECRC Check Failed will be reported by the receiver, though the TLP will still be forwarded as normal.

row.entry:
Non-advisory case: Uncorrectable error processing.
Advisory case: Correctable error processingSee table ECRC Check Failed Error Report.

entry.p: Unsupported Request
See Table 5 .
Yes if a function claims the TLP. Else No.
Unsupported Request Detected bit (PCIEXP.DEVSTAT.URD) is set.
If the request is a non-posted request, reply using Completion with UR status for the non-posted request and log Advisory error.
If the request is a posted request, log the uncorrectable error.
Non-advisory case: Uncorrectable error processing.
Advisory case: Correctable error processing.
Completion Timeout
Switchtec doesn't send non-posted request.
Completer Abort
If the Request violates the programming model of the device Function, the Function treats the Request as a Completer Abort, instead of handling the Request normally.
If the Request violates the NT programming rule, it is a Completer Abort Error.
Yes

row.entry: Signaled Target Abort bit is set in Status Register or Secondary Status Register.

entry.p: If the request is a non-posted request, reply using Completion with CA status for the non-posted request and log Advisory error.
If the request is posted request, log the uncorrectable error.
Non-advisory case: Uncorrectable error processing.
Advisory case: Correctable error processing.
Unexpected Completion

If:
The completion can't be forwarded Or
The completion is targeted to the P2P function or vEP function(Switchtec doesn't send non-posted request, so completion is not expected) Then the Completion is an Unexpected Completion and is dropped.
If the completion can't be forwarded by the switch, it is non-function specific, report error on all functions in the ingress port that receives the unexpected completion.
If the completion is targeted to the P2P function or vEP function, it is function specific.

row.entry:
Non-advisory case: Uncorrectable error processing.
Advisory case: Correctable error processing.
Log the error in AER Header Log Register.

entry.p: ACS violation

entry.b: ACS violation checks performed by DSP:

row.entry: The Signaled Target Abort bit is set in the Secondary Status register

entry.p: If TLP is a non-posted request, a completion with completer abort status is generated. Note that this is not considered a completer abort error in AER.
Non-advisory case: uncorrectable error processing
Advisory case: correctable error processing.
TLP header logged in AER.
The offending TLP is dropped.
MC Blocked TLP
For the transparent MC Blocked TLP or MC Blocked TLP of NT EP Mode 2, the P2P in ingress port serves as the Completer, for the MC Blocked TLP of NT EP Mode 1, the NT EP servers as the Completer.
Yes

row.entry: The Signaled Target Abort bit is set in Status register(for Downstream MC TLP) or Secondary Status register(for Upstream MC TLP) in P2P of the ingress port.

entry.p: Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
AtomicOp Egress Blocked
TLP Prefix Blocked
Receiver Overflow
Detected by the PCIe switch port.
No
Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Flow Control Protocol Error
Detected by the PCIe switch port.
No
Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Malformed TLP
Detected by the AER.
No
Log the uncorrectable error in AER register of all functions associated with that component
Request blocked by ingress port
If the Ingress port is a DSP, the associated P2P function's BME is set to 0.
If the Ingress port is an USP, the associated P2P or vEP function's MSE or IOSE is set to 0.
Ingress port is in D3 HOT state
The ingress port's associated P2P function is in D3 HOT state.
Refer to PWR control section
Request blocked by egress port
If the Egress port is a DSP, the associated P2P or vEP function's MSE or IOSE is set to 0.
If the Egress port is an USP, the associated P2P function's BME is set to 0.
Egress port is in D3 HOT state
The ingress port's associated P2P function is in D3 HOT state.
Refer to PWR control section
Type1 Configuration Request to access the USP associated function

row.entry: The USP receives the Type1 Configuration Request and the Bus of the Device ID is the primary bus number of the USP.

entry.p: Configuration Request Received from DSP

row.entry: The DSP receives the Configuration Request.

entry.p: Unsupported Request to P2P or vEP function

row.entry: An Atomic Operation that checks for a reserved message code and a VDM Type 0 message.

entry.p: Un-routable Request/Message

row.entry: The USP receives the Request/Message which can not be routed.

entry.p: Upstream Port
Downstream Port
If the poisoned TLP is a Completion with Data (CplD)

ul.li: Set the Detected Parity Error(DPE) bit in the Status register of the ingress port's P2P function.
Set the Master Data Parity Error(MDPE) bit in the Status register of the ingress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of the egress port's P2P function.
Set the MDPE bit in the Status register of the egress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

entry.p: If the poisoned TLP is a Request (MSGD, MW and IOW)

ul.li: Set the DPE bit in the Status register of the ingress port's P2P function.
Set the MDPE bit in the Secondary Status register of the ingress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of the egress port's P2P function.
Set the MDPE bit in the Secondary Status register of the egress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

entry.p: Report the Poisoned TLP Received Error in the ingress port's P2P function as intermediate receiver.
USP P2P function inside switch

If the poisoned TLP is a CplD
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of USP P2P.
Set the MDPE bit in the Status register of USP P2P, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

If the poisoned TLP is a Request (MSGD)
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of USP P2P.
Report Unexpected Completion or Unsupported Request in USP P2P function as ultimate receiver.
vEP function inside switch

If the poisoned TLP is a CplD
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of vEP.
Set the MDPE bit in the Status register of vEP, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

If the poisoned TLP is a Request (MSGD, MW or IOW)
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of vEP.
If the poisoned TLP is CplD, report Unexpected Completion in vEP function.
If the poisoned TLP is MW, report the Poisoned TLP Received as uncorrectable error regardless of the Advisory Error report.

If the poisoned TLP is MSGD and not VDM Type 1 message, report Unsupported Request for un-supported message or report Poisoned TLP Received as uncorrectable error regardless of the Advisory Error report for supported message.
If the poisoned TLP is VMD Type 1 message, silently drop it.
If the poisoned TLP is configuration write request, return a Completion with Unsupported Request.
DSP P2P function inside switch

If the poisoned TLP is a CplD
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of USP P2P.
Set the MDPE bit in the Status register of USP P2P, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of DSP P2P.
Set the MDPE bit in the Status register of DSP P2P, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

If the poisoned TLP is a Request (MSGD, MW and IOW)
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of USP P2P.
Set the MDPE bit in the Secondary Status register of USP P2P, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of DSP P2P.
Report Unexpected Completion or Unsupported Request in DSP P2P function as ultimate receiver.
Report Poisoned TLP Received Error in ingress port's P2P function
Downstream Port
Downstream Port

If the poisoned TLP is a CplD
Set the DPE bit in the Secondary Status register of ingress port's P2P function.
Set the MDPE bit in the Secondary Status register of ingress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.
Set the DPE bit in the Status register of egress port's P2P function.
Set the MDPE bit in the Status register of egress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

Report the Poisoned TLP Received Error in ingress port's P2P function as intermediate receiver.

If the poisoned TLP is a CplD

Set the DPE bit in the Secondary Status register of egress port's P2P function.
Report Unexpected Completion or Unsupported Request in USP P2P function as ultimate receiver.

If the poisoned TLP is a CplD
Set the DPE bit in the Secondary Status register of ingress port's P2P function.
Set the MDPE bit in the Secondary Status register of ingress port's P2P function, if the Parity Error Response bit in the Command register is set.

Set the DPE bit in the Secondary Status register of ingress port's P2P function.

entry.p: Upstream Port
Downstream Port
Report the ECRC Check Failed error in the ingress port's P2P function as intermediate receiver.
According to PCIE Spec, intermediate receiver will handle ECRC Check Failed error as an advisory non-fatal error if its uncorrectable error severity is configured to be non-fatal.
USP P2P function inside switch
Report ECRC Check Failed error in USP P2P function as ultimate receiver.
vEP function inside switch
Report ECRC Check Failed error in vEP function as ultimate receiver.
DSP P2P function inside switch
Report the ECRC Check Failed error in the ingress port's P2P function as intermediate receiver.
According to PCIE Spec, intermediate receiver will handle ECRC Check Failed error as an advisory non-fatal error if its uncorrectable error severity is configured to be non-fatal.
Report ECRC Check Failed error in DSP P2P function as ultimate receiver.
Downstream Port
Upstream Port
Report the ECRC Check Failed error in the ingress port's P2P function as intermediate receiver
According to PCIE Spec, intermediate receiver will handle ECRC Check Failed error as an advisory non-fatal error if its uncorrectable error severity is configured to be non-fatal.
USP P2P function inside switch
Report the ECRC Check Failed error in the ingress port's P2P function as intermediate receiver.

Report ECRC Check Failed error in USP P2P function as ultimate receiver.
vEP function inside switch

section.title: Errors reported in Non-Transparent operation
section.p: A Non-Transparent Error is a PCIe error that only involves NT Window in NT EP functions. Those errors which are non-function specific or involving P2P functions, are described in the Transparent Error section.

A Physical Layer Error and Data Link Layer Error are Transparent non-function specific errors. Transaction Layer, Receiver Overflow, Flow Control Protocol and Malformed TLP Errors, are non-function specific and are not reported as Non-Transparent Errors. The remaining errors would be classified as Non-Transparent errors.

A Non-Transparent error can be the TLP error directly received from the link or logically claimed by the NT EP. For some errors, it is necessary to determine if the function that receives a TLP from the link is an “ultimate receiver” or “intermediate receiver”. The NT function is always considered an ultimate receiver when the TLP is received directly from the link. This applies to all TLPs, including NT multicast TLPs.

entry.p: Poisoned TLP Recevied

If:
the packet was addressed to a NT window
no violations of the NT programming rules
the EP bits are set
No higher precedences error occurs. Then it is a NT Poisoned TLP. The TLP is forwarded across the NTB to the destination partition.

row.entry:
The DPE bit is set.
If the poisoned TLP is a completion, and the MDPE Detected bit is set (if PCICMD.PERRE is set).No Error was reported on the destination partition's NT EP or P2P function.

entry.p: If the TLP is received from the upstream port. The NT EP reports this error as Advisory case "Correctable Error Processing".
If the TLP is received from the downstream port. The downstream P2P reports this error as Advisory case "Correctable Error Processing".
ECRC Check Failed

row.entry:
If:
the packet was addressed to a NT window
no violations of the NT programming rules
the TD bits are set
ECRC is incorrect
No higher precedences error occurs
Then it is a NT ECRC Check Failed. The TLP is still forwarded across the NTB to the destination partition.

entry.p: The NT EP reports this error as Uncorrectable Error.
In addition, if the TLP is received from the downstream port. The downstream P2P reports this error as Advisory case "Correctable Error Processing".
Unsupported Request
The UR is only reported when no function claims the request. The Non-Transparent Errors are function specific error.
Completion time-out
Switchtec doesn't track the End-to-End Non-Transparent transaction.
Completion Abort

If:
the request is targeted to NT BAR in NT EP,
violates any of the following NT programming rule
the address is within NT BAR but not falls into any NT Window, or
the NT Window is not configured after NT EP is reset or after Swtichtec power up, or
the destination partition of NT Window is reset
ID Protect check failed if ID Protect is enabled
No higher precedences error occurs. Then the NT should issue completion with "CA".

row.entry:
The Signaled Target Abort bit (PCISTS.STA) is set.
Reply to the Completion with CA status for the non-posted request.No Error was reported on the destination partition's NT EP or P2P function.

entry.p: The NT EP reports this error as an Advisory case if the request is non-posted. Otherwise reports this error as uncorrectable error.
Unexpected completion received

If NT function receives a completion TLP whose requester ID matches the NT function's bus and device number. As well as the function number matches the NT function's number, then this is an unexpected completion
The NT EP reports this error as an Advisory case. The completion is dropped.
Completion with UR received
The NT EP doesn't send out non-posted requests. Received UR completion is handled as unexpected completion received.
Completion with CA received
The NT EP doesn't send out non-posted requests. Received CA completion is handled as unexpected completion received.

section.title: Error Reporting With Multi-Function Device (Upstream Port)
section.p: The example of a Multi-Function Device with an Upstream Port containing one P2P and one vEP:

ol.li: Upstream Port contains one P2P(function 0) and one NT EP(function 1)
Upstream Port contains one P2P(function 0) and one Management EP(function 1)

section.p: In a Multi-Function device, PCI Express errors that are not related to any specific function are logged in the corresponding status and logging registers, of all Functions in that device. The error message is only sent once by one of the functions for the same error functions in that device.

The error message is supposed to be sent only once per severity, when it happens to encounters a non function-specific error. Since the severity for both functions is FATAL, only one error message (FATAL) should be sent. If the severity for both functions are FATAL and NON_FATAL, two error message (FATAL & NON_FATAL) should be sent.
The handling of UR (unsupported requests) in a Multi-Function Upstream Port has the following limitations:

ol.li:
Ingress Blocking for Non-D0 State Multi-Function
Ingress Blocking is enabled in Upstream Port only when all functions of Multi-Function Upstream Port are in Non-D0 state. All Type 1 Configuration Requests, Memory and I/O requests flowing downstream or targeted vEP are terminated as Unsupported Request. If one function is in D0 state, then request handling will not effect the D state of the Multi-Function device.

Ingress Blocking for Multi-Function with MSE enabled/disabled
If MSE is enabled in the US P2P and MSE is disabled in vEP, then all Memory Requests flowing downstream are unaffected, but the Memory Requests targeting vEPs are terminated as an Unsupported Request.
If MSE is disabled in the US P2P and MSE is enabled in vEP, then all Memory Requests received from the USP are replied with a UR. Memory Requests received from the DSP and targeted to the vEP are handled normally.

Ingress Blocking for Multi-Function with IOSE disabled
Ingress Blocking is enabled for IO Requests in Upstream Ports only when IOSE is disabled in function 0. All IO Requests flowing downstream or targeting vEP are terminated as Unsupported Request.

li.p: Ingress Blocking for Multi-Function with BME enabled/disabled

If BME is disabled in the US P2P and BME is enabled in the vEP, all Transparent requests targeted to the USP are replied as UR. All Non-Transparent requests targeted to the USP are replied as CA in the source partition The Non-Transparent requests targeted to the DSP would be forwarded normally.
If BME is enabled in the US P2P and BME is disabled in the vEP, all Transparent requests are forwarded normally. All Non-Transparent requests are replied as CA in the source partition.
